title: Friday, 11th May, 2018
bodyHTML:
11:07 am
BE11:07am

Hi there. Good morning. Welcome to ML.

Paper Chase Hullo.
SupposeToBeWorking... Morning all
Soundbuy Morning
SoS hiya
BE11:08am

Going with this for the portrait today:

BE11:08am

11:09 am
BE11:09am

That's the FT XI vs the McClean XI, in the Paul McClean Remembrance Match 2018.

A. M. Morning all.
RA HEY
BE11:10am

The FT lost 3-1. David Sheppard of the energy team got the consolation goal.

BE11:10am

And more importantly, £9,914.68 raised for Royal Marsden and Anthony Nolan.

11:10 am
BE11:11am

Well done to all who participated, and hopefully it becomes an annual event.

undefined
BE11:11am

Okay, so where do we start? Here, I guess.

11:11 am
ZPG PLC (ZPG:LSE): Last: 489.00, up 113.8 (+30.33%), High: 490.00, Low: 485.00, Volume: 6.67m
Fox Any idea why utilities are down so much today with stable UK rates, falling bond yields? UU, SVT down 3%. Shorter driven?
BE11:12am

(@Fox: Bernstein downgrade. We'll get to it.)

Soundbuy Rising energy costs?
BE11:12am

Rally from 334p at the back of April look a wee bit suspicious here, though I don't think any media picked up on it.

GBKrona Jambo
11:13 am
BE11:13am

This is, to catch us up, Silver Lake Management buying ZPG for 490p apiece.

Imperial Goldsmith Jes?
Fox @soundbuy United Utilities, Severn Trent = Water
BE11:14am

31% premium, trailing PE of about 26 times I think.

DRichi It closed yesterday at 375p. That's some premium to pay
Fox Perhaps Gove has opened his mouth again?
Soundbuy Evaporation?
BE11:14am

(Water utilities: Bernstein downgrade. We'll get to it. For Flip's Sake.)

Anton Bernstein note - on UK waters -mind you bear in mind analyst is of the type that models UK coal output as constant
Anton when its declining (on the names exposed to that)
11:15 am
BE11:15am

DMGT, nearly 30% shareholder, has accepted so the chances of a counter look not great.

A. M. (I guess I'm somewhat apocalyptic this morning, because to me ZPG meant that 70s dystopia film)
Badger shouldn't that be "for Fox sake?"
BE11:16am

Some vague stuff around the potential for Axel Springer to be interested ..... Such as this from Liberum:

Anton Bernstein also big bull on CNA into the PW last year in spite of clear evidence of customer losses (you just had to look at switching data and peers). When it blows up writes up a farcical 'open letter to management' (vs eating some humble pie)
BE11:17am

The question now is whether there is a counter-bid. If there is one, we think the most likely candidate is Axel Springer (NR), which has a collection of online property classified assets throughout assets but nothing in the UK, although - interestingly - they recently took a stake in Purplebricks (NR). AS has a market cap of €7.2bn and is on less than 1.5x consensus YE18E net debt / EBITDA. Obviously a big +ve on ZPG, which has been our preferred pick in the portals space

Upaswellasdown @Fox - WACC review ?
Fox Which site do people prefer for broker updates?
11:18 am
BE11:18am

On the flipside, you have a very large premium to pay and a very tight timeline to worth within.

BE11:19am

As Barclays says:

chopper bear itv off on one today
BE11:19am

Could there be a counter bid?

We think the answer is that a counter bid is quite unlikely given 1) this is a healthy premium, and 2) the largest shareholders have said they will accept the Silver Lake bid. DMGT (largest ZPG shareholder with 29.8%) and the board (1.2%) have agreed to sell their shares.

The Scheme Doc will come out “as soon as practicable” and the Court Meeting and General Meeting will be held on or around 19 June 2018. It needs 75% approval. If they get approval from European Commission and FCA, it should all happen during Q3.

So any counter bid would need to happen by mid to late June we think. It isn’t impossible but it isn’t the base case.

11:19 am
BE11:19am

..... okay, so sector.

Rightmove PLC (RMV:LSE): Last: 4,904, up 301 (+6.54%), High: 4,934, Low: 4,751, Volume: 209.51k
Anton Brokers? The main problem with sell-side research is that analysts are encouraged to think like traders. I don't understand the thinking behind it.Day traders more often that not lose moneyCompare number of billionaire day traders vs number of billionaire fundamental investors!
BE11:20am

................ which is a bit odd? I mean, Rightmove has historically traded as a premium to ZPG because it's the Coke to Zoopla's Pepsi ......

Fox ITV up 5%. WPP flat.
11:21 am
BE11:21am

.... but ZPG's model's changed. It's cross selling rather than just property pr0n.

tangledodyssey ITV also very high volumes traded today
BE11:22am

Here's Citi.

BE11:22am

Rightmove is ZPG’s closest peer in the portal space but has yet to significantly diversify away from core online classified activities. In terms of sentiment, it seems likely that RMV will be seen as a beneficiary of the ZPG news but we see two sticking points: (1) as above, it seems likely that at least part of the rationale for Silver Lake’s interest is the non-portal diversification activities in particular in property software/data; and (2) the fact that RMV already trades at a premium even to ZPG’s bid price (25.2x 2019E P/E, 20.8x EV/EBITDA, 3.5% FCF yield). We are Sellers.

11:22 am
BE11:23am

The one that tends to be getting tipped more aggressively this morning is Auto Trader, such as this again from Citi.

BE11:23am

Auto Trader does not operate in the property vertical but is a strong online classified player and there are arguably more parallels with ZPG in the sense that a key plank of the investment case is based on the ability of the group to sell through more services to car dealers. Even more importantly, in contrast to RMV, Auto Trader trades at a pronounced discount to the implied ZPG valuation – the group is on 18.3x 2019E P/E, 15.3x EV/EBITDA and 5.6% FCF yield. We rate AUTO Buy.

BE11:23am

And this from Morgan Stanley.

11:23 am
BE11:23am

Trading on 17x calendar 2019e Auto Trader looks very attractive both relative to this transaction (22x), Rightmove (23x) and its own trading history (24x). We expect the company to continue to report solid results with ARPR growth supported by the new financing product (c.280k cars now listed under the new “monthly price” option vs. c.400k dealer listings).

BE11:26am

And, for a sector sweep, Barclays.

BE11:26am

Clearly the multiple paid is somewhat supportive of the Rightmove valuation but the fact remains that Rightmove is facing slowing growth on peak agents (with several pain points recently). It is also supportive of the Moneysupermarket valuation, although with the caveat that the six month period where ZPG couldn’t come back for Gocompare is now finished and that deal would be easier to integrate under private ownership (and could increase competition for Moneysupermarket). There is nothing suggesting ZPG / Silver Lake plan to do this though – it might very well be a bid purely based on the fundamentals of ZPG standalone. There is also some positive readover in terms of multiple paid for the wider property classified space (Scout24, Schibsted, Axel Springer, Zillow). We have always argued that cross border synergies in property classifieds are not that large so the option of a global roll-up story resulting doesn’t feel like the base case here (but isn’t impossible). The likely market interest on whether classifieds businesses could receive bids will not be limited to property players, in our view, so e.g. Autotrader also gets a positive readover.

11:26 am
undefined
BE11:26am

Okay, so ITV.

ITV PLC (ITV:LSE): Last: 167.75, up 7.4 (+4.61%), High: 168.75, Low: 160.35, Volume: 19.68m
wayneJ The MOST analyst has clearly not looked at the embedded assumptions in the monthly calculator for Auto Trader. Or not spoken to the MOST autos analyst.
11:27 am
BE11:27am

We've done about four times the average volume this morning.

BE11:28am

(@Fox: I find this website invaluable for broker updates: https://www.ft.com...-93a0-6bd08a66c2e1 )

RA im amazed by indices atm, i noticed donald trump hasnt mentioned much on the failed chinese trade delegation the other week
BE11:28am

..... Why? Well, clearly, yesterday's trading update has led to something of a reconsideration.

Flaneur How much of these rises are due to Carneys knocking sterling in to the basement yesterday?
11:29 am
BE11:29am

And McCall's masterstroke of getting everyone to talk about "total advertising" rather than NAR, which means online and product placement and stuff keeps things growing in spite of a pretty poor market for actual adverts.

Soundbuy Liberum have called this well...........
BE11:29am

On top of that, inevitably, you have Liberty Global getting cashed up.

BE11:30am

..... albeit eventually. We're also starting to talk about ITV as a strategic asset again. Here's a bit from JP Morgan Caz.

11:31 am
BE11:31am

Strategic value: ITV offers English language content and has the most efficient platform for the video monetisation of content in the UK. We believe it is strategic to telcos given the opportunity to use its content channels cross promotion to drive convergence benefits / quad play market share and much bigger revenue streams. We believe that content is also becoming more important to tech given that it drives engagement which can be monetised across a broader ecosystem. Addressable TV will make FTA increasingly strategic as it will become by far and away the biggest platform for data driven targeted video advertising with very high quality, brand safe ad inventory.

BE11:31am

Liberty Global has a 10% stake in ITV and should the UK become a bigger part of its portfolio and it have increased financial flexibility in the coming months, it may look to realise potential synergies from: 1) using ITV’s content, channels and cross promotion to differentiate its quad play; 2) production distribution synergies for ITV studios All3Media; 3) cost savings; 4) addressable TV with Virgin potentially using the better monetisation of its platform, ITV’s inventory to drive higher margins, or lower retail prices (with Virgin giving the addressable TV ARPU uplift back to customers) to drive higher penetration / market share; and 5) the accelerated use of tax assets.

BE11:34am

Aye, maybe. Or maybe, given Liberty didn't bid at an unaffected price of 145p, they'll keep not bidding at a circa 170p.

Paper Chase McCall seems to have engineered a turn in sentiment with little more than a flick of the wrist. Quite the trick.
11:35 am
BE11:35am

Said it yesterday and will say it again: mobile looks much more like a strategic priority for Virgin in the UK, particularly if BT uses EE to start a convergence price war.

wayneJ @Paper Chase - when a CEO appears so smart I find it useful to review their track record...
BE11:36am

But, hey, ITV's cheap. 10 or 11 times earnings. If there's anything else supporting today's rally, we don't know about it.

undefined
Paper Chase @wayneJ I wouldn't disagree with you there.
11:36 am
BE11:36am

Okay, so this bloody Bernstein note on the utilities.

Severn Trent PLC (SVT:LSE): Last: 1,978, down 42 (-2.08%), High: 2,006, Low: 1,954, Volume: 589.17k
United Utilities Group PLC (UU.:LSE): Last: 768.00, down 13.2 (-1.69%), High: 781.80, Low: 756.40, Volume: 994.01k
11:36 am
BE11:37am

Take profit.

BE11:37am

Because Ofwat's making big noises about dividend caps and stuff.

Paper Chase ...but compare it with BT's incomprehensible nonsense yesterday.
BE11:38am

And with Ofwat also suggesting that customers should see some of the benefit of gearing utilities up the bahookie, M&A at a big premium to RAV looks unlikely.

11:39 am
BE11:39am

Let me share a few pars.

BE11:39am

Dividend caps: Ofwat suggested that companies' ability to pay dividends should be restricted to 5% of the equity Regulatory Capital Value (RCV). This implied cap is ~15% and ~17% below our dividend estimates for SVT and UU respectively in FY20 (See Exhibit 2 and Exhibit 3). Putting the cap to one side, we believe the lower WACC alone will drive dividend reductions for both companies in the next regulatory period - 5% for UU and 7% for SVT.

BE11:40am

And ............

11:39 am
BE11:40am

The "Tail risk" scenario of nationalisation is not in our valuation but implies scope for material downside: While we have not assigned any weight to a nationalisation scenario in our refreshed valuation, our recent work points to material downside in the event of nationalisation. Assuming the book value of equity will be paid by a future Labour Government, we estimate a nationalisation value of £2.35bn for United Utilities (55% downside), and £2.6bn for Severn Trent (44% downside.

BE11:40am

Nationalisation at book value of equity? Hm.

wayneJ Re utilities - the basic investor assumption seems to be that they have an inflation linked mandate. However I think they risk the public ire and issues re what is in the regulated asset base - and at what cost. I dare not mention a certain 'infrastructure' play in the UK where the prime contractor (often selected after public tender) is another part of the same group....and charges rather eyewatering prices.
Flaneur Whats happening in Italy re: banks. New 5Star govt cant be good for them can it?
wayneJ Also what happens to utilities that have offshore structures for their debt; or if there is an interest cap?
BE11:43am

As in, total assets less external liabilities. But with the possibility of a discount if the utilities haven't been behaving themselves, digging up roads enough, etc.

wayneJ I put it to members of the jury that the 5 year average adjusted return on equity for Severn Trent is 30% - is that justified?
11:43 am
BE11:43am

Using this, Bernstein reaches a value of £14.2bn on the top nine water utils.

BE11:43am

That's against industry estimates of £90bn.

Pharma @Flaneur, I've seen little to convince me that 5star will be good for anything or anybody. They seem to set policy on a whim (and a prayer)
BE11:45am

To put that in context, I think the pothole repair budget is estimated to reach somewhere around £14bn by the end of the decade.

11:45 am
BE11:46am

Imagine the court cases. Anyway, that's that.

undefined
wayneJ Ofwat ought to regulate management payout as well.
Pharma Problem with water companies is they are still local monopolies. I pay a fortune to United Utilities for a product that literally falls out of the sky in vast quantities (NW england)
Anton As the French do with French SOEs?
wayneJ Why does the CEO of Severn Trent earn £2.45M? What does the job entail that is so extraordinary to justify that?
BE11:48am

So where do we go from here?

wayneJ (Salary 674l; bonus 616k; stock awards 974k; pension 168; 'other compensation' 18k - source Bloomberg).
wayneJ ((Sorry that was salary of 674k))
11:49 am
BE11:49am

There's G4S, which is up on a breakup theory.

G4S PLC (GFS:LSE): Last: 267.60, up 7.1 (+2.73%), High: 269.30, Low: 262.60, Volume: 2.16m
BE11:50am

Via Exane. Does the maths on G4S spinning out its cash solutions business.

11:51 am
BE11:51am

Via trade sale or, failing that, a breakup and piecemeal sale to regional competitors.

BE11:52am

Based on listed cash peers, we believe an average 2018 EV/EBITA multiple of 11.6x,
with a potential small premium for G4S Cash given higher exposure to value add
services and leading position in retail solutions could be justified. At a 12x EV/EBITA
multiple we estimate the business value at cGBP1.8bn; adding in the potential value of
synergies (c5-6% revs) this suggests total EV of GBP2.5bn

BE11:53am

.... with a trade buyer able to pay a lot more, obv, given the scope for cost cuts. Brinks' purchase of Maco Transportadora in Brazil last year involved synergies at 12% of revenues apparently.

wayneJ Errr? Isn't the Exane price target 280 - so not a lot of upside from here?
Gross Loydman Any Serica comment?
Forester Water Companies - nationalisation likely, no. Meaningful action by Offwat...not that likely. Cheeky buy for me!
11:54 am
BE11:54am

So .... G4S raises at least £2.2bn by flogging the cash carting business, uses it to cut debt and bump returns, and you get 10-20% EPS accretion.

Electric Dragon @Pharma - as a former employee of UU, I should point out that what you're paying for is a) making the stuff that falls out of the sky drinkable, b) piping it to your home and c) taking the waste away and cleaning that up.
undefined
cracklenpop @pharma The north has water, the south doesn't - Nicola Fish in her Holyrood fortress is on to something.
Pharma @Electric, I appreciate that, but my parents pay a lot less for a larger house in a part of the country where getting the water in the first place is much more of a challenge.
BE11:56am

In all honesty, I'd forgotten Serica Energy existed.

wayneJ @Electric Dragon - as a former employee of UU do you have any views on the CEO's total compensation of £2.3M (in 2017)?
11:56 am
Serica Energy PLC (SQZ:LSE): Last: 55.22, down 7.78 (-12.35%), High: 65.00, Low: 53.20, Volume: 4.47m
Pharma @wayneJ - maybe he was his predecessor
Pharma (or she)
BE11:57am

London, 9 May 2018 - Serica Energy plc (AIM:SQZ) notes the statements made yesterday evening by President Trump in relation to Iran.

The Company is evaluating the implications of these statements and how they relate to the Rhum field in which th‎e Iranian Oil Company (U.K.) Limited is a 50% partner. We will update the market, as appropriate, in due course.

wayneJ I note the CEO of UU is on the board of G4S and was on the board of Carillion.
wayneJ @Pharma - :-)
RA am i wrong to feel bearish on the nasdaq?
BE11:59am

Okay, so the Rhum HPHT gas field. Block 3/29a, 44km north of Bruce

11:59 am
BE11:59am

Which it's tied back to.

wayneJ May be of some interest - https://www.ft.com/content/2cc6dd5c-2e7e-11e8-9b4b-bc4b9f08f381
BE12:00pm

Discovered in 1977, but was not developed until 2005 because it's High Pressure, High Temperature.

BE12:00pm

Production was restarted October 2014, having been shut in from November 2010 due to Iran EU sanctions.

12:01 pm
BE12:01pm

Here's Cantor's expectations:

BE12:01pm

Gross production in 1H17 averaged 155mmcfd and
1,273bpd of condensate (28,517boepd). Production is anticipated to increase later
this year following the code change for maximum percentage of CO2 that can be
delivered at St Fergus terminal (increased to 5.5% from 3.8%). This change will allow
Rhum production to flow unconstrained for the remainder of its life (subject to
compression constraints). BP are planning to drill a recompletion on the R3 well in
1H18, which should bring three producers on-stream, and increase 2018 production
175mmcfd and 1,900bpd. Remaining gross reserves per the 2017 CPR were assessed
as 442bcf and 4.9mmbbls (41.3mmboe net).

BE12:02pm

Its most recent model puts Rhum at 87p per share.

12:02 pm
BE12:02pm

Or 16p risked NAV.

BE12:03pm

Here, have the box.

BE12:03pm

12:03 pm
undefined
BE12:05pm

That'll do, right? That's enough for a Friday.

Paper Chase An interesting session today, thanks BE. Have good weekends, all.
Gross Loydman @BE, thanks
tangledodyssey BE, thank you, enjoy your weekend.
SupposeToBeWorking... Thanks
GBKrona thanks @BE. ROTR
wayneJ @BE - u are worth the salary of any utility CEO; thank you.
cracklenpop @ Electric DragonSeem to remember a former UU CEO had to quit after setting up a Macclesfield love nest with the chairman's PA...
BE12:06pm

Thank you awfully for all the comments. See you next week. Afternoon all.
